required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of SC-006 in Subjects With Advanced Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Study of SC-006 in Subjects With Advanced Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, Phase 1 study in participants with colorectal cancer (CRC), and consists of Part A (dose regimen finding), followed by Part B (dose expansion). Part A (dose regimen finding) will involve dose escalation and possible dose interval modification to define the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) and schedule. Part B (dose expansion) will enroll additional participants who will be treated with a study drug dose at or below the MTD determined in Part A.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with dose-limiting toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Minimum first cycle of dosing (21-day cycles)
primary_outcome.description: DLTs graded according to the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version 4.03.

secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants whose best overall response is either complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as determined by Investigator assessment using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR) defined as CR, PR, or stable disease (SD)
secondary_outcome.description: CBR is defined as the percentage of participants who achieve a best response of CR, PR, or stable disease (SD).
PFS time is defined as the time from the participant's first dose of study drug (Day 1) to either the participant's disease progression or death due to any cause.
DOR is defined as the time from the participant's initial objective response (CR or PR) to disease progression or death, whichever occurs first.
DOCB is defined as the time from the initial partial response (PR), complete response (CR), or stable disease to disease progression.
OS is defined as the time from the participant's first dose date to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) of SC-006
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed serum concentration of SC-006

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve within a dosing interval (AUC) of SC-006
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve within a dosing interval of SC-006

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed plasma concentrations at trough (Ctrough) of SC-006
secondary_outcome.description: Observed plasma concentrations at trough of SC-006

arm_group.description: SC-006 intravenous (IV) (various doses and dose regimens)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced metastatic or unresectable colorectal cancer (CRC) that is relapsed, refractory, or progressive following at least 2 prior systemic regimens in the metastatic setting.
- Participants with an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) of 0 - 1.
- Participants with adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with prior exposure to a pyrrolobenzodiazepine or indolinobenzodiazepine based drug.
